name: InterContinental Taba Heights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked my holiday through Longwood Travel. Brilliant travel company, there to answer all questions including what type of visa is required, when we landed at Taba airport. A very nice touch on getting on the coach was a welcom bottle of water.
reviews.title: Great Getaway
nice location, great looking hotel
reviews.text: Arrrived at the hotel, checkin was very quick, we were given directions and a map to our room which overlooked the saltwater lake, and the sea. Wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was very good, although the choice was a little limited.
reviews.title: It's gone downhill

likes.disliked: — Had to pay extra for this - not worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However I managed to eat very well.
reviews.title: What a fantastic week

likes.liked: — Great staff. right on the beach
likes.disliked: — leaving it to get on an Egyptian coach

reviews.text: The beach was very nice, with a breeze going across it most of the time. The temperature was warmer than normal, as Eygpt was having a heatwave, plenty of sunscrean required.
reviews.title: all inclusive not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Intercontinental from 3 to 17 June 08.
reviews.title: Brill hotel but not quite 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked with Thompson’s and flew with First Choice from Manchester. As this length of flight is deemed to be short haul I squeezed into the Boeing cattle truck and prepared to lose the use of my legs. We took off an hour late for no apparent reason and then found that the film was unavailable to rows 1-20 on left hand side (guess where I was) and so I amused myself watching the staff try to cope with being handed Thompson free drinks vouchers when it obviously isn’t in first Choice training pack. We eventually arrived at Taba hut and got through to our coach remarkably quickly. The return journey with the added bonus of the lady in front of me with the extra leg room also reclining like she had a contract to kneecap me. she was sick several times(ha ha ha) None of this is fault of hotel so I won’t deduct anything.
reviews.title: stunning hotel, shame we didnt see much of it.

reviews.text: If you travel to Egypt you will get an upset stomach to some degree and whilst neither my wife or I were confined to bed my stomach bubbled away for two weeks like a stew in the slow cooker.
reviews.title: Another Fantastic Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving at the Intercontinental we were checked in pretty quickly and after identifying our cases we were pointed into the darkness in general direction of the Atrium building where we found our room on floor 3 overlooking salt lake and sea. Although some of the exterior views are reminiscent of San Quentin the rooms are big and excellent with enough of everything including a fridge containing gold plated drinks and snacks (judging by prices and these are not in AC package). Nice comfy beds and chairs and yes the shower is huge.
reviews.title: Beatiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For 12 days of our holiday it seemed that the hotel was only around half full (unless the other half were confined to their loo) as there was always plenty of space. This review would probably have been different if it was maximum capacity.
reviews.title: Summary of my May Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is awesome. Maybe I haven't been anywhere in the world but people seem awfully picky about what was bad rather than what was good. I am 27, house, decent job and such and this is the best holiday I have been on.
reviews.title: Awesome place - can't believe how picky some people are!

likes.liked: — The whole place in general - it looks exactly like the pics on the website!
likes.disliked: — The fact the bars shut at 11.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew out Tues 27th - yes there was a 3 1/2 hour delay but that meant more time in the bar. The blokes at the airport try and demand tips for picking up a suitcase. Bearing in mind it was 2am it was sort of a case of wondering if this would be the norm. That was the only time I felt pressured to tip anyone for the whole week. And you dont have to - just grab your bag if needs be - they are being greedy.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect Holiday

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of the hotel, food and drink and the friendliness of staff.
likes.disliked: — Some of the shops there were overpriced and stocked fake goods.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got to the hotel at 3am local time. Transfer is about 45 mins from the airport and the coach will generally stop at all 4 main hotels and drop people off. That at first seems a nightmare but all 4 are about half a mile apart max. Check in was easy and took 2 mins. The porters bring your cases up and ours arrived in 10 mins. We also then got room service that we weren't expecting which was due to the time we arrived - a nice touch.
reviews.title: Not as good as last year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the pool areas and bars are great and the staff could not do enough for you. Amazing what a smile and a bit of friendly banter does to get people on side. The pic on the website shows the salt lake which is great. Its to the left of the main pools and is pumped in from the sea. The Lagoon bar is the square looking one that is situated in the salt lake. Went there for drinks but didn't eat as we weren't to fussed by mexican. Nice at night though looking over the lake. There is a fantastic bar to the right of the complex sat almost on the beach - has beanbags to sit on and its great to relax with a beer after dinner. Plus the bar staff in that one seemed to be up for a larf a touch more than the others. Big shout out to Amr (prounounced Ammer) who was called MC for the rest of the holiday - of course.
reviews.title: Luxurious Hotel with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - The food I thought was great. you had a load of stations that served a wide range. There seemed to be a sort of a theme each night but there was still loads of other options. They did like a bit of seabass in various forms some of which were better than others. No matter what though there was something for everyone and a massive range of puddings and so on for people to choose from. Here's a quick tip though. Go and have a look round the options first - then get your plate. 2 or 3 occasions I had got some dinner then wanted something i found a bit further down the line. This however may be a given for all inc holidays - this was my first one.
reviews.title: Won't be going back here....

reviews.text: This hotel and location are everything they say they are but not a 5 star. I'd say they've been given an extra star for the golf course and Spa facilities which never seemed to be used. It’s very nice and on the whole, clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful with a sound understanding of English and I'm certain other languages. All the public areas were well stocked with sun beds or seats and the restaurant never felt over crowded. The on site staff from Waterworld couldn't do enough to help. The bedroom and bathroom were large and comfortable. The Longwood Rep was excellent and very informative about all the trips and excursions on offer. We did the Canyon quad bike which was fun and you should hire snorkel gear from the hotel. The sea is like a bath with plenty to view off the small man made reefs.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where the hotel lets is self down is on food hygiene. I normally have the gut of a Sherman tank but of the guests we spoke with, half had or knew someone else who had some sort of stomach complaint. It puts a bit of a downer on your holiday and makes you very weary of trying anything other than the hot food. All the food stations look clean and the staff appear attentive, may be it's something you have to live with and hope you're not one of the unlucky ones.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

likes.disliked: — Food was at times not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had seven days of cloudless skies and 40 degrees, not much less at night with a warm wind. This was a problem in reception, no A/C. It was as warm outside as in.
reviews.title: Truly a 5-star hotel and service

likes.disliked: — Had to really think about this; the reception area should have air-con but it would need a redesign (it has an open roof) to accomodate it. Perhaps those two loose mosaic tiles in the shower floor should've been picked up by the cleaner and repaired before we were allocated the room...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be warned about Taba airport, it's basic, very basic. A counter selling drinks and snacks and toilets from the time of Moses.
reviews.title: Wonderfull Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't think I'll be back here just because I've been. Great place if you want a beach type holiday with guaranteed weather. Think I'll try Mexico next time though.
reviews.title: OK but not so great

description: InterContinental Taba Heights Resort is part of a premier resort community on the Red Sea coast. Surrounded by desert mountains, white sand beaches and turquoise waters, it offers a wealth of leisure options including golf, water sports, shopping and gaming. A short drive away are Pharaoh s Island, Colored Canyon and the Taba Protected Area.
